masterUrl.description: URL to a remote Kubernetes API server. This should only be used when your Camel application is connecting from outside Kubernetes. If you run your Camel application inside Kubernetes, then you can use local or client as the URL to tell Camel to run in local mode. If you connect remotely to Kubernetes, then you may also need some of the many other configuration options for secured connection with certificates, etc.

connectionTimeout.label: advanced
connectionTimeout.description: Connection timeout in milliseconds to use when making requests to the Kubernetes API server.

leaseResourceType.description: Kubernetes resource type used to hold the leases.

kubernetesResourcesNamespace.description: Kubernetes namespace containing the pods and the ConfigMap used for locking.

kubernetesResourceName.description: Name of the resource used for locking (or prefix, in case multiple ones are used).

groupName.description: Name of the lock group (or namespace according to the Camel cluster convention) within the chosen ConfigMap.

podName.description: Name of the current pod (defaults to host name).

clusterLabels.description: Labels used to identify the members of the cluster.

jitterFactor.description: A jitter factor to apply in order to prevent all pods to call Kubernetes APIs in the same instant.

leaseDurationMillis.description: The default duration of the lease for the current leader.

renewDeadlineMillis.description: The deadline after which the leader must stop its services because it may have lost the leadership.

retryPeriodMillis.description: The time between two subsequent attempts to check and acquire the leadership. It is randomized using the jitter factor.

configuration.label: advanced
configuration.description: To use an existing configuration for Kubernetes
